intro: Anthelis albidus, commonly known as the white anthelis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense tufts. Anthelis albidus is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
